steps.title: Measure out the length between the wall and where your sheet ends[1] X Research source
steps.content: Measure out the length between the wall and where your sheet ends [1] X Research source

steps.title: Make to length mark on a sheet of drywall, snap a chalk line between the two.
steps.content: Make to length mark on a sheet of drywall, snap a chalk line between the two. Using a knife, score the drywall on your chalk out line.

steps.title: Snap the drywall back, and cut the back of the drywall to remove the excess piece
steps.content: Snap the drywall back, and cut the back of the drywall to remove the excess piece

steps.title: Fit the drywall piece on your wall, using screws secure the drywall to the studs, only four screws needed, one screw near the top, one at the bottom, and the last two in the field(or middle of the sheet)[2] X Research source
steps.content: Fit the drywall piece on your wall, using screws secure the drywall to the studs, only four screws needed, one screw near the top, one at the bottom, and the last two in the field(or middle of the sheet) [2] X Research source

steps.title: Sink down the screws only slightly below the surface of the drywall, making sure not to screw in to much
steps.content: Sink down the screws only slightly below the surface of the drywall, making sure not to screw in to much

steps.title: Repeat the steps 1 through 5 to put on top sheets and the corners other side, making sure to cut back the drywall from the corner where the bead is going to go, about a 1⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) so the bead fits
steps.content: Repeat the steps 1 through 5 to put on top sheets and the corners other side, making sure to cut back the drywall from the corner where the bead is going to go, about a 1 ⁄ 4 inch (0.6 cm) so the bead fits

steps.title: Measure the length of bead your going to need, using this measurement cut your bead[3] X Research source
steps.content: Measure the length of bead your going to need, using this measurement cut your bead [3] X Research source

steps.title: Apply taping mud to both side of the drywall sheets, be generous as you don't want any dry spots.
steps.content: Apply taping mud to both side of the drywall sheets, be generous as you don't want any dry spots. Apply bead and press hard on the middle squish mud from behind through the little holes. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Remove all excess mud while filling all the little hole at the same time[5] X Research source
steps.content: Remove all excess mud while filling all the little hole at the same time [5] X Research source
